metadata.title: CVE-2021-47168 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: NFS:fix an incorrect limit in filelayout_decode_layout() The "sizeof(structnfs_fh)" is two bytes too large and could lead to memory corruption. Itshould be NFS_MAXFHSIZE because that's the size of the ->data[] buffer. Ireversed the size of the arguments to put the variable on the left.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
